isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 10 SPEED AND 15 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RT, RTO, AND RTX SERIES - REMOVE - AUXILIARY SECTION

figure.caption: Figure 39. Auxiliary Countershaft Assembly

step1.para: Secure the auxiliary housing in a vise ( Figure 40). Remove the auxiliary countershaft straps and the countershaft shims (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 40. Remove Auxiliary Countershaft Straps and Countershaft Shims

note.para: The upper countershaft may fall from the auxiliary section.

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul to partially drive the output shaft forward ( Figure 41).

figure.caption: Figure 41. Drive Output Shaft Forward

step1.para: Remove the upper auxiliary countershaft ( Figure 42).

figure.caption: Figure 42. Remove Upper Auxiliary Countershaft

step1.para: Remove the lower auxiliary countershaft by prying the main shaft up and pulling the countershaft out ( Figure 43).

figure.caption: Figure 43. Remove Lower Auxiliary Countershaft

step1.para: If necessary, secure the countershaft assemblies in a vise and remove both the front and rear bearings with a C-clamp and jaw pullers ( Figure 44).

figure.caption: Figure 44. Secure Countershaft Assemblies in Vise

step1.para: Remove the two countershaft races from the auxiliary housing bores ( Figure 45).

figure.caption: Figure 45. Remove Countershaft Races From Auxiliary Housing Bores

step1.para: Remove the five bolts with washers (inset, Figure 46). Remove the cylinder cover and gasket.

figure.caption: Figure 46. Remove Cylinder Cover and Gasket

step1.para: If necessary, remove the insert valve retaining nut from the cylinder cover ( Figure 47). Remove the insert valve from the bore (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 47. Remove Insert Valve From Bore

step1.para: Remove the 15/16 inch nut on the range yoke bar (left, Figure 48) and the 3/4 inch nut on the reduction yoke bar (right).

figure.caption: Figure 48. Remove Nut on Range Yoke Bar and on Reduction Yoke Bar

step1.para: Remove the cylinder housing and gasket ( Figure 49).

figure.caption: Figure 49. Remove Cylinder Housing and Gasket

step1.para: Remove the range and reduction pistons from the cylinder bores ( Figure 50).

figure.caption: Figure 50. Remove Range and Reduction Pistons From Cylinder Bores

step1.para: If necessary, remove the O-rings from the range cylinder bore (left, Figure 51) and the reduction cylinder bore (right).

figure.caption: Figure 51. Remove O-Rings From Range Cylinder Bore and Reduction Cylinder Bore

step1.para: If necessary, remove the O-ring from the I.D. and O.D. of the range piston and the O.D. of the reduction piston (inset, Figure 52).

figure.caption: Figure 52. Remove O-Ring From I.D. and O.D. of Range Piston and O.D. of Reduction Piston

step1.para: Remove the range yoke assembly and synchronizer ( Figure 53). Remove the range yoke assembly from the synchronizer sliding clutch.

figure.caption: Figure 53. Remove Range Yoke Assembly

step1.para: Temporarily install the output yoke on the output shaft ( Figure 54). Insert a breaker bar to keep the output shaft from turning.

figure.caption: Figure 54. Temporarily Install Output Yoke on Output Shaft

step1.para: Remove the 1-1/2 inch range coupler nut ( Figure 55). Remove the output yoke from the output shaft.

figure.caption: Figure 55. Remove Range Coupler Nut

step1.para: Remove the washer and dowel pin from the auxiliary mainshaft ( Figure 56).

figure.caption: Figure 56. Remove Washer and Dowel Pin From Auxiliary Mainshaft

step1.para: Remove the low range gear with the coupler ( Figure 57).

figure.caption: Figure 57. Remove Low Range Gear With Coupler

step1.para: With a punch and hammer, drive the two coupler pins from the coupler (inset, Figure 58). Align the coupler splines with the washer splines and remove the range coupler from the low range gear.

figure.caption: Figure 58. Drive Coupler Pins From Coupler, Align Coupler Splines, and Remove Range Coupler

step1.para: If necessary, remove the bushings from inside the coupler ( Figure 59).

figure.caption: Figure 59. Remove Bushings From Inside Coupler

step1.para: Remove the splined washer from inside the low range gear ( Figure 60).

figure.caption: Figure 60. Remove Splined Washer From Inside Low Range Gear

step1.para: Remove the sliding clutch and the reduction yoke assembly from the auxiliary housing ( Figure 61).

figure.caption: Figure 61. Remove Sliding Clutch and Reduction Yoke Assembly

svcsubproc.title: Output Shaft and Rear Bearing Assemblies

step1.para: Use a soft bar and maul to completely drive the output shaft forward and through the rear bearing assembly ( Figure 62).

figure.caption: Figure 62. Drive Output Shaft Forward

step1.para: If so equipped, remove the bearing inner spacer from the output shaft ( Figure 63).

figure.caption: Figure 63. Remove Bearing Inner Spacer From Output Shaft
